page.title: 15SHELFORD-LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Shelford is a small village, population 220 people situated on the banks of the River Trent.There is evidence of a settlement here from earliest times;the name Shelford is taken from the Anglo Saxon name which means shallow ford.The river was constantly deepened during the 18th &19th Centuries to carry heavier loads so the ford no longer exists. The main industry is farming,with 9 farms in this small area.All of the land is owned by the Crown and the farmers pay rent on an annual basis. The residents of Shelford fall into 3 main categories;the farmers and those associated with the farms;those who have lived in Shelford all their lives and either work on the land or in Nottingham;the people who are new to Shelford who commute to Nottingham, Newark or Leicester.
